attributes.action: ensure that common sense, fair play and the observance of the spirit and intent as well as the letter of the law becomes part of Britains national heritage.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Lawyers have been ignoring common sense, fair play and the intent/spirit of the law ever since literalist judge Lord Tenterden stipulated, in the 19th century, that the letter rather than the spirit of the law should be followed, ”regardless of the consequences.” One of the consequences is that liars, thieves, cheats, criminals, lawyers and even politicians are now able to justify or condone behaviour which is clearly antisocial and totally unacceptable to all decent hardworking folk. The practice, which has been a cancer upon our society for generations, should no longer be tolerated.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
